meanings.sent1: The librarian enregistered the new books in the library system.
meanings.sent2: She enregistered the birth of her baby at the town hall.
meanings.sent3: The cat enregistered its territory by leaving paw prints all over the garden.
meanings.sent4: His smile enregistered in her memory, brightening even the darkest days.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm enregistered its presence with booming thunder and flashing lightning.

meanings.definition: To enter or inscribe in a register or list.
meanings.sent1: Please enregistered your name on the attendance sheet.
meanings.sent2: He enregistered the important dates in his planner.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel enregistered its acorn stash on a secret map.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter enregistered in his heart, bringing warmth on cold nights.
meanings.sent5: The artist enregistered the beauty of the sunset in a breathtaking painting.
